recipe_ingredients: 200g spaghetti, 100g pancetta diced, 2 large eggs, 50g grated Pecorino Romano cheese, 2 cloves garlic minced, Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe_content: Boil spaghetti until al dente. In a pan, cook pancetta and garlic until crispy. In a bowl, whisk eggs and cheese. Drain spaghetti and add to the pancetta pan. Turn off the heat and quickly mix in the egg mixture. The heat will cook the eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

recipe_ingredients: 4 boneless, skinless chicken breasts 2 lemons, juiced and zested 2 tbsp olive oil 2 cloves garlic minced, 1 tsp dried thyme, 1 tsp dried rosemary Salt and pepper to taste
recipe_content: In a bowl, mix lemon juice, zest, olive oil, garlic, thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Marinate chicken in the mixture for 30 minutes. Grill chicken until cooked through, about 6 minutes per side. Serve with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice.

recipe_ingredients: 1 cup cooked quinoa, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved 1 cucumber diced 1 red bell pepper diced,1/4 cup red onion finely chopped, 1/4 cup fresh parsley chopped,2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp lemon juice, Salt and pepper to taste
recipe_content: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, tomatoes, cucumber, red bell pepper, red onion, and parsley. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Chill before serving.

recipe_ingredients: 400g beef sirloin, thinly sliced, 2 cups broccoli florets, 1/4 cup soy sauce,2 tbsp oyster sauce, 1 tbsp cornstarch, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp ginger grated, 2 tbsp vegetable oil, Cooked rice for serving
recipe_content: In a bowl, mix soy sauce, oyster sauce, cornstarch, garlic, and ginger. Marinate beef in the mixture for 15 minutes. In a wok or large pan, heat vegetable oil over high heat. Stir-fry beef until browned. Add broccoli and stir-fry until tender. Serve over rice.

recipe_ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) diced tomatoes, 1 cup vegetable broth, 1 cup heavy cream, 1/4 cup fresh basil, chopped, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 onion, chopped, 2 tbsp butter, Salt and black pepper to taste, Croutons, for garnish
recipe_content: In a pot, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and onion, sauté until softened. Add diced tomatoes and vegetable broth, bring to a simmer. Blend the mixture until smooth. Return to the pot, stir in heavy cream and basil. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with croutons on top.

recipe_ingredients: 24 ladyfingers, 1 cup strong brewed coffee, cooled, 1 cup mascarpone cheese, 1/2 cup heavy cream, 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 1 tsp vanilla extract, Cocoa powder, for dusting
recipe_content: In a bowl, combine mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract. Whip until smooth and creamy. Dip ladyfingers in brewed coffee and arrange a layer in a serving dish. Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture on top. Repeat the layers, ending with the mascarpone mixture on top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, dust the top with cocoa powder. Enjoy this classic Italian dessert!

recipe_ingredients: 2 cans (400g each) chickpeas, drained and rinsed, 1 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 1 cucumber, diced, 1/4 cup Kalamata olives, pitted and sliced, 1/4 cup red onion, finely chopped, 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese, 2 tbsp olive oil, 2 tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 tsp dried oregano, Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe_content: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, tomatoes, cucumber, olives, red onion, and feta cheese. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper. Pour dressing over the salad and toss to combine. Serve chilled.

recipe_ingredients: 4 salmon fillets, 3 tbsp honey, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp ginger, grated, 2 green onions, sliced, Sesame seeds, for garnish, Cooked rice, for serving
recipe_content: In a bowl, mix honey, soy sauce, rice vinegar, garlic, and ginger. Marinate salmon in the mixture for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 200°C (390°F). Place salmon on a baking sheet, reserving the marinade. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked through. In a saucepan, simmer the reserved marinade until thickened. Drizzle glaze over salmon, garnish with green onions and sesame seeds. Serve with rice.

recipe_ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeded, 2 cups cooked chicken, shredded, 1 cup cooked quinoa, 1/2 cup basil pesto, 1/4 cup cherry tomatoes, halved, 1/4 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe_content: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F). In a bowl, mix shredded chicken, cooked quinoa, basil pesto, cherry tomatoes, mozzarella cheese, salt, and pepper. Stuff the pepper halves with the mixture. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 20 minutes until peppers are tender and the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

recipe_ingredients: 4 bell peppers, halved and seeded, 1 lb ground beef, 1 cup cooked rice, 1 cup diced tomatoes, 1 cup shredded cheddar cheese, 1/4 cup chopped onion, 2 cloves garlic, minced, 1 tsp ground cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, Salt and black pepper to taste
recipe_content: In a bowl, combine mascarpone cheese, heavy cream, powdered sugar, and vanilla extract. Whip until smooth and creamy. Dip ladyfingers in brewed coffee and arrange a layer in a serving dish. Spread a layer of the mascarpone mixture on top. Repeat the layers, ending with the mascarpone mixture on top. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Before serving, dust the top with cocoa powder. Enjoy this classic Italian dessert!
